TestSet.Name: mount
TestSet.StartUp: Skip ( !PartitionManager::NoOptionsEnabled(), "These tests should run only when no options are provided." );

Test.Name: WrongResize
mountVFSV1
ErrPanicOption
Test.Code: mount(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, MS_REMOUNT, "errors=panic"); umount(DeviceName);

Test.Name: ErrAbortOption
JournalUpdateRemount
Test.Code: //works only without remount flag. Check( mount( DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, MS_REMOUNT,"journal=update") == 0, "Mount should fail, but it did not");

Test.Name: JournalDevRemount
Test.Code: //works only without remount flag. Check( mount( DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, MS_REMOUNT,"journal_dev=0") == 0, "Mount should fail, but it did not");

Test.Name: DataOrderedRemount
Test.Code: //works only without remount flag. Check( mount( DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, MS_REMOUNT,"data=ordered") == -1, "Mount failed.");

Test.Name: DataWritebackRemount
Test.Code: //works only without remount flag. mount( DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, MS_REMOUNT,"data=writeback");//will fail!

Test.Name: MountWithExternalLog
Test.Description: Create ext4 fs with external log.
Test.Footer: Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: MountWithExternalLogFail
Test.Description: Corrupt superblock so that mount fails.
Test.Footer: Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: MountFail1
Test.Description: Corrupt superblock so that mount fails.
Test.Footer: Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: MountFail2
Test.Description: Corrupt superblock so that mount fails.
Test.Code: Unres( !PartitionManager::ReleasePartition(MountPoint), "Cannot unmount."); PartitionManager::Mount(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, "delalloc,data=journal");//will fail

Test.Name: MountFail3
Test.Description: Corrupt superblock so that mount fails.
Test.Code: Unres( !PartitionManager::ReleasePartition(MountPoint), "Cannot unmount."); PartitionManager::Mount(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, "dioread_nolock,data=journal");//will fail

Test.Name: MountFail4
Test.Description: Corrupt superblock so that mount fails.
Test.Footer: Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: MountFail5
Test.Description: Corrupt superblock so that mount fails.
Test.Footer: Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: Ext4_setup_super1
Test.Description: Change some superblock values and mount.
Test.Footer: Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: Ext4_setup_super2
Test.Description: Change some superblock values and mount.
Test.Footer: Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: OrphanCleanup1
Test.Description: Mark orphan inode in superblock and mount.
Test.Footer: Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: OrphanCleanup2
Test.Description: Creates a file and mark it its inode orphan in superblock.
Test.Footer: Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: DefaultOptions1
Test.Footer: Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: DefaultOptions2
Test.Footer: Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: DefaultOptions3
Test.Footer: Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: HashLegacy
HashTea
Test.Footer: rmdir("test_dir"); Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: HashHalfMD4Unsigned
Test.Footer: rmdir("test_dir"); Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: HashLegacyUnsigned
Test.Footer: rmdir("test_dir"); Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );

Test.Name: HashTeaUnsigned
Test.Footer: rmdir("test_dir"); Fatal( PartitionManager::RestorePartition(DeviceName, MountPoint, FileSystem, true) != PS_Success,"Mount failed" );
